title: Paulownia and Pin-Oak Leaf Sizes
description: The Pin Oak (Quercus palustris) leaf at left is 14 cm from the tip to the end of the stem and 9 cm in width (5-12 x 3-1/2 in.) The Paulownia leaf (Paulownia tomentosa) is 51 cm from the tip to the end of the stem and 25 cm in width (20 x 10 in.) Both are typical leaves from their species. Leaves on a young Paulownia tree may be 60cm (24 in.) in width.The abaxial (back) surface of the Paulownia leaf is softer than the finest velvet.Strobist: Single Canon Speedlite with a Gary Fong diffuser on a small light stand. Canon ST-E3-RT radio trigger.
